alert.note: Alert for Albany; Laramie (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 29 at 8:53PM MDT until June 29 at 9:15PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM MDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN ALBANY AND WEST CENTRAL LARAMIE COUNTIES... At 852 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near University Of Wyoming War Memorial Stadium to near Tie City Campground to Pumpkin Vine, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. Locations impacted include... Laramie, Tie City Campground, Vedauwoo, University Of Wyoming War Memorial Stadium, The Buttes, Vedauwoo Campground, Yellow Pine Campground and North Crow Campground. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 309 and 330. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southeastern Wyoming. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
